WmbCsgjHZNp_Mq6SzwmV9A.text: We were recommended this place by a couple people. Sushi was really good. I've had better rolls elsewhere but the nigiri and sashimi was fantastic. Glad we made the effort to try a new spot. Prices are good too.

mkMMHiTl4tzPdf9487JyqA.text: Outstanding team service in a casual atmosphere.  Great selection of both classic sushi menu and some twists of creativity.  All high quality and absolutely delicious.  Presentation was also top notch.  My wife also found a gem with the grilled shrimp mushroom and asparagus dish.  Desert was "spiritual" according to my daughter.  Will be back at the next possible opportunity.

4xzSOfGGeU-4l7Em39Q4ig.text: One of my go-to sushi spots. The fish is always fresh and delicious and they have the most unique ways of preparing the fish. They are happy to accommodate special dietary needs like my need for everything to be gluten-free. Also open late.

uI2izN6FZvpUCXz7UwE5oA.text: Its just OK. I like their variety in menu...and thats the only thing that i liked. I went late with my boyfriend for a late night dinner and the place wad empty ( should have known right then and there) i ordered a few things and as im eating i swear my waitress disappeared for a good 20 minutes. She didnt even give us soy sauce for our rolls and wasabi. (Screaming orgasm sauce? It was the worst ive ever had) anyhow im waiting there for my refill and no waitress for 20 minutes. The place was empty where was she? So i walk towards thw kitchen and i ask someone cleaning for the waitress and he asks me what do i need. Hahaha i need some SERVICE thats what i needed. I told the guy i wanted my check and as soon as i said that the waitress came to my table 3 times in 5 minutes.   I was looking forward to this place but the service turned me off. We were the only table there but she couldnt even give us refills for 20 minutes and made us walk up to the kitchen guy for a refill and our check.   Until i try again with a different waitress? Its just wasnt worth my money tonight.  ---- so i go again after about a month and a half since ive written the first part of this review. Same problem but much more wait. I took my own bottle of water this time so i wont go thirsty. I ordered a few things first and i added a bowl of rice. When she came i asked for a spoon since their rice got choppy cus it was old (i know this cus im asian and know exactly how rice should be) anyhow rice was fine but i just wanted a spoon to eat it with and no joke it took 15 minutes. There was one table other than mine and there were two servers. By the time she came with the spoon it was too late i got tired from the wait.  It sucks that a place with such good tasting food has such low quality service. Sad tsk tsk.

WED2yF5fDaJee4ujSDdESw.text: Incredible sushi restaurant. Nick is a fantastic manager and will really take care of you.

mx1V8pKJQjvN0x7GqoiZrw.text: The BEST, BEST, BEST sushi I have had outside of Japan!!! I love how they mix unique sauces and yummy vegetables or capers to certain sashimi and make it into a visual masterpiece that tastes as amazing as it looks. This is the place for foodie photo taking people to go! Extraordinary presentation of the food!!  I love how unique this place is and how knowledgeable the staff and chefs are about pairing fish with different things. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!! A must go to sushi restaurant away from the Vegas strip!

uu6tQ2jJ0jmKDMwQABDaVw.text: I feel for what it's worth it's a bit overpriced and overrated. Tried the miso black cod lettuce wrap, octopus carpaccio, duck, #10 and #11 special rolls, fried calamari salad, and tomato salad. Nothing was bad, but nothing really stood out for me. I think I've been ruined by kabuto and yonaka modern japanese. This place is most likely a one and done for me.

ML0qva8hkkTTusszTJ3wNA.text: The food and atmosphere were absolutely wonderful. The staff was amazing.  I actually left my purse hook at the table and the lady ran across the parking lot into the mad house coffee shop to give it to me. Who would do that in 100+ degree weather?  So if you want great sushi and great service Sen of Japan is the place to go.

gJG9jbPcJWaUN2VAFQYG1g.text: I really enjoyed eating here. The sushi was delicious. But I do feel they didn't price the restaurant properly. When I searched for sushi restaurants in the area I found this spot and it was listed with just two $$, but if you just order two rolls it's over $30 already, so I feel like it should've been listed with three $$$.

b10Qs71mW_wsT37GC9jqWQ.text: Probably the best off strip sushi place in Las vegas. Prices are relatively reasonable compared with strip. I had the omakase and that's the way to go at this place. They have not only sushi but cooked asian/Japanese dishes that's very good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Sen of Japan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5P_LM7T_zyB5ByglsKYn9w.text: This review is for their happy hour -   Sen offers a variety of cut rolls, apps, and nigiri sushi all for under 10 bucks an item.  It's extremely affordable and the overall quality is excellent.  They don't offer too many nigiri selection (not as much as Yummy Grill and Sushi) but the quality is really fresh and the sushi rice is well flavored.   They have about 8 selections with your standard salmon, tuna, yellowtail, shrimp, etc.   The cut rolls are standard fare  - your spicy salmon, philly, cucumber, eel rolls but are well priced as well at 3-4 bucks.  The star of the happy hour is the miso black cod lettuce wraps.   Do yourself a favor and order at least 2-3 per person.   Everything about it is delicious with the slight salty miso flavor coupled with the nice textural bite from the noodles inside the lettuce.    The salmon carpaccio was also very good - think Yonaka.....delicate and full of flavor.   Overall, Sen's a great happy hour.  I prefer the extensive nigiri selection from Yummy and the delicate flavors from Yonaka better.

VC9y8Ahwtui_w8BqwvMnYw.text: The best late night happy hour for sushi (not saying teppenyaki..which isn't even really Japanese anyways...) anywhere in town!!  Apparently no one is even aware of this cuz the place was empty around midnight on a recent Friday night.  It would be a shame if a sushi restaurant like this didn't thrive in a city that's basically sushi crazy.    Go sit at the bar and ask the chef what the best cuts of fish are for the day.  They make some great stuff not on the menu.

WpvJ7oSjV0L6T7knuY3IPA.text: I came here with my father and brother hoping to find a new sushi place since my brother wanted sushi. What I got was beyond my expectations! I orderd the seafood soup clear and loved ever bit of it! The sea food tasted great plus I loved the scallops. The sushi here unlike many uses real crab instead of the usual fake. My dad said the sushi dident even because it prepared so well. Plus almost all the items are made in house making it a great place for people with food allergies to know exactly what's in their food. I know this is a great place to go when ever I need so great quality homemade japanese food, and I will surely come back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Sen of Japan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sushi combination. Yum

QCTX4RWQc5_bhyOD2Bf0cg.text: Just to make things clear, I still love Sen of Japan and it will always be my favorite restaurant here in Vegas. The reason for this update is that sadly, I do have to agree with some of the yelpers who have said that customer service was bad here.    My husband and I usually sit at the bar, but sometimes we come in when it is pretty crowded and have no choice but to sit at a table. This was the case during our last visit. No big deal, we are regulars here, so we understand that on some days, if we don't come in around the time that they open, there will be no open seats at the bar.  The problem was that customer service was not great like it usually is for us. I think our waitress was new because I have never seen her before, and most of the staff already knows who we are. She was not very attentive. She took a while to refill our drinks and because she did not check up on us, we had to wait a long time to put in our second round of orders for sushi. Thank god the waiter who knew us stopped by our table to help us! We also noticed that if you order sushi, they service the customers who sit at the bar first, which also explains why we experienced a longer wait time. There was also a family sitting in back of us who was complaining about not getting their food. We wanted to order dessert, but decided not to because we didn't want to spend another 30 minutes (or who knows how long) in the restaurant.   So the bottom line is this: if you want good service, sit at the bar! Get there early or right when they open at 5pm. All the sushi chefs are great, but I think my boy Sonny is the best!!

XwVdtoqPwfc1RdMidYRRqg.text: Luv it, luv it! Fish was fresh, the sauce was divine.  You have to order the sashimi.  We have been there many times.  The omakase was great for first timers.  But then, try to order some other dishes too.  The h1n1-4 was awesome .  We went there for late night meals with happy hour plates.  The lettuce wrap was the bomb, a must have.  The calamari tempura was great.  The salmon carpaccio was to die for....I guess I was listing just about everything I ate there was great.  Highly recommend it.  The chef was very friendly.  Service was top notch

4vS_iXUrgur7NrY78NqPnQ.text: The sushi wasnt bad but way over priced. It took longer then it should have to finally be served, there were 4 chefs and not even busy. I put one star cuz the food was decent but I'll never come again. The bill was $43 and it was just me eating.

plbIIy0hR4sQ87gFuEVxqQ.text: This is my 3rd time going to this place and I will definitely go again. The service is great and the food is good as well. Fresh sushi and the presentation was nice as well.

_tZoM0ObGEh8ruOUxpodUw.text: Sometimes places leave you speechless and it is okay. Sometimes you don't need to drone on and on about how good the food is. Sen of Japan leaves that almost perfect impression on me and it is hard to put it into words.   Starting out with the Hawaiian style edamame is a must. So is the mixed seafood cucumber salad. From that point, it only got better. All of the nigiri was fresh, a generous slice, but could have held back on the dressing. At points, the rice was falling apart due to how much sauce was on some of the pieces.   My friends that I had dined with had prefaced that Sen's miso black cod rivals that of Nobu's. I had to get it and for $14, it is a steal. The steak with the sweet soy based sauce was freaking fantastic. Dragging the meat through it to dab on my rice was not enough. I should have been as smart as my dining partner and just tipped the plate over my rice.   You need to save room for the chocolate souffle with green tea ice cream. It is magnificent. The nice crunch from the shell to the gooey center pairs so well with the homemade ice cream. I died so many times throughout the meal.  I cannot complain about one thing that hit our table. I call that a win with around eight different fishes, a few appetizers, a couple of entrees, and two desserts.

ghPKG5H0FNDoaTx6g5bylA.text: Very simple, very authentic, very fresh.  Some of the best Japanese food off the strip but with prices that make you feel you're there.  Nigiri sushi is very good.  The rice is well seasoned.  The fish is very fresh.  If they have it, the O-Toro is worth it.  it's the real deal.  All the tempura is all perfectly cooked but are the least authentic of their offerings.  That said, the sea urchin is excellent.  Sumibi-yaki dishes are simple and very tasty.    Standouts from the dinner menu include the yellowtail and salmon with spicy garlic ponzu, the kobe carpaccio, grilled fish collar, the black cod with foie gras, and the fresh deep fried soft shell crab.  All are very creative.  They are all well seasoned and perfect with a cold beer or well chilled sake.  Never had the chance to try the omakase yet but based on the creativity of the chef, I'd guess its excellent.  Service is good.  Prices are on the high side but well worth it to avoid the Strip.

xjitwjDMxMczQhRnPQMXlw.text: This restaurant is a great place to have genuine sushi while winding down on some wine and brews! The service is incredible and the aroma is comforting! I highly recommend you try this!

t8ZSa2z694rrWHa0roM7zA.text: Why it took me 1.5yrs since I moved to Vegas to write about my regular spot baffles me. Let me start off by saying that I was not a big sushi lover to begin with. But after a visit to Sen, I was quickly sucked into the hypnotizing world of sushi. I now come here about once or twice a month with my fiance and it is our jam!  We don't eat shell fish so I can't vouch for those items, but any of their fish sashimi or negiri is amazinggg. So fresh, CLEAN, tasty, delicate and refined. The albacore is my favorite- feels like a pillow puff in my mouth.  The staff is incredible as well. They all have the extensive menus memorized, so attentive and professional. To sum it up, you're getting Nobu quality but better tasting for half the price.

Jup-2kxTcDryk6TiEoppKw.text: We are regular customers since it first opened, food has always been great, high quality of fish most of the time, occasionally some fish were not that fresh.  We haven't been back for the last 2 months, when we returned last night, we were very disappointed, noticed the thickness of the fish on the sushi rolls was much thinner than it used to be. We also had tuna rolls, and the fish didn't seem too fresh.  We left some on the plate, not tasty at all. Other dishes were still great, will I return again, yes, but not that soon!!! By then......Hoping that they will come to their senses and bring it up a notch.

JLyw0apKByVVPZNb4Acujg.text: Best sushi in Vegas. Period. I've managed a sushi joint and had sushi all over the world. This menu is unlike any sushi menu I've come across. So so good I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sen of Japan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Shrimp Nigiri. Life-changing. Torched on top with shitake mushrooms!

bw3KhY_n7x4zjCec_WR9CA.text: I never thought I'd be singing the praises of filet mignon sushi, but here I am.  I've been to this place several times, but after the last trip I had to come tell you all how great it is.  My gf and I were headed to Naked Fish the other night, not because it's our favorite, but because it's where we had our first date so we like to go back once in a while.  We arrived to find an hour wait, which meant goodbye Naked Fish, hello Sen of Japan.  We sat at the bar for the first time and I must tell you, unless you're with a large group, this is the best way to go.  The chefs are so attentive and friendly, it made for a much better experience.  I started with the miso-shittake soup while the gf had the agedashi with japanese eggplant.  Both were nice twists on old favorites.  The spider roll done caterpillar style with avocado and sweet chili sause was so good we had to get another.  I've had a lot of sushi in my life, but the tuna I had there that night was simply the best piece of fish I've ever tasted.  Bottom line - if you're looking to pig out, go somewhere else to an all you can eat.  If you want a wide variety of good food and great service, come here.

JNmZfDDAMBkt8nFHRu9BqA.text: Temporal Combination, Filet Mignon steak w bell pepper was nice and tender, cooked just right, Shrimp tempura roll and caterpillar roll, mochi peanut butter.

Sv7hypTqquDfSaWspKuj8A.text: We haven't been here in awhile so we decided to go last Sunday to see if it was as good as we remembered.  It was pretty busy, and busier than their norm, so the service was lacking, but the sushi was amazing!  Definitely on par with the sushi restaurants on the strip.  I heard before that the owner was the head sushi chef at nobu and it definitely shows.  A lot of the menu items are almost identical to nobu's menu.  But I didn't mind that at all since nobu is my fav!  However, soj goes further outside of the box with their menu.  For sushi lovers I would definitely recommend the shin's special plate.  It was amazing! Delicate, beautiful, fresh pieces of assorted sushi each topped with a special sauce.  I would also recommend the yellowtail and salmon in spicy ponzu sauce.It was beautiful and delicious as well.  We also had the Hawaiian style edamame, too salty for me, uni, not the best I've had, but not the worst!  Spicy tuna handrolls, amazing. Oysters with salsa, amazing. Tempura, really good. And chocolate cake with green tea icecream for dessert, identical to the bento box dessert at nobu!  Overall a great meal, will go back again soon.

btwybooMhncFIfWNZM5T5w.text: Absolute favorite place to go for Japanese/sushi.  Highest quality food, breath-taking presentation.  The staff is very knowledgeable about sake and is very happy to help you make the perfect selection.  The place is just bomb.  I'll be the one dancing in the corner to the softly playing techno music with hamachi hanging out my mouth.

0ej10b0NzSFI6LbsCAiEvQ.text: Great little place! The Manderin Shrimp is my favorite, I can eat 2 orders. The rolls have been quite pleasing as well. There are some very interesting ones to choose from. Fun to go in and try new things!!

fq5NeLTGylhge2En2pMXAA.text: Sen is some of the best sushi I've had in Las Vegas. I highly recommend the spicy edamame too!

9U4TAu_S5TzTP_tq5MRkQA.text: The quality of the sushi we had is 100% five stars, however, what drops it from five to two is the overall experience.  It was a Friday night, we did not have reservations and called Sen of Japan to see if they could squeeze us in. The first person that picked up the phone did not speak English that well, asked me to hold and came back on line again five mins later. I inquired about going in for dinner and then she said hold on. At that time an English speaking person got on the phone and said that if we wanted to, we could come in at 7:30 and if there was tables available they would sit us, otherwise put us in the sushi bar. Okay, since the sushi was highly rated we decided to give it at try. This place is in the burbs off the strip and is about a $30 taxi ride each way including tip,  When we arrived, there was no hostess at the area where the counter was so we just sat in the chairs waiting. A man came up to us, looked at us and then sent another person to come to us. She asked if we had reservations and I recognized her voice and told her we had spoken on the phone and she told us to swing in to see what they could do, and she said, oh yeah I remember, please wait. From our view we observed two tables that each sat two people that where empty for 20 minutes. Two workers came in and looked at us as more people where arriving and hoovering around, yet when we inquired about the two empty tables we were ignored.  One employee greeted another employee as she arrived for work with the phrase, "Welcome to Hell".  After 45 minutes we sat at the sushi bar and the sushi chef said I will be with you in a minute. 15 mins went by, and we ordered Miso , Edamame, Tempura Sweet Potato, to start. It arrived 20 mins later. after that was finished, we just waiting for his que to order as he was too busy yelling at the other sushi chefs for making mistakes. After being at the Sushi bar for a total of 45 mins, (those two empty tables still empty), we ordered 28 pieces of sushi.  The first order arrived 15 minutes after we ordered and then it started to trickle in a bit faster.  The quality of the sushi is by far some of the best I have had and in my opinion would beat anything in the Bay Area for quality.  However, the overall 3 hour dining experience was not worth it.  The price is reasonable, we spent $180 on the food + $60 for the taxi.  But again, it was perhaps in my opinion the worse managed Japanese restaurant and poorly trained employees I have experienced in my life time.  We won't go back

aWIik5A4xxVJltlqNKv6yA.text: One of the best sushi restaurants in Las Vegas. It's off the strip and I didn't even mind the cab ride. High quality fish and excellent service. Get the $85 Omakase and you'll not be disappointed. They also have a $55 Omakase with lower quality dishes. If you don't mind going off the strip for great food, here's a list of restaurants to consider: bit.ly/mQq41b

NK2V7ksqz_f2iEsMnPzkwA.text: You get what you pay for, and Sen of Japan lives by those words. It is pricy, however, don't let that discourage you. It WON'T disappoint you! Fantastic sushi, wonderful service, great menu to choose from, and they'll even create ANYTHING you desire. Being a native of sushi (I LOVE THEIR UNI), its simply a pleasure going here for sushi. Whether you're a local or visiting, Sen of Japan is a must visit!

I5jiUb4ljJurHPU7XOsIiQ.text: BEST sushi i've had in a long time!!! everything was so fresh and tasty! we got the black cod lettuce wraps, lisa lisa roll, and other random pieces. the service is just as good as the food! the prices are really good as well. usually you find a good sushi place and the prices are ridiculous! but this is just right... you defiantly should hit it up!!!

AyYbWWi_lTg2GgMInrXVag.text: I have been reluctant to try a sushi restaurant since moving from San Diego.  Alas, after almost a year in town, and after countless inquiries from locals as to where to go, this is the place I tried.  I have to say, the restaurant's atmosphere itself is a little disappointing.  Definitely not much ambiance.  The food and service, however, definitely made up for it!  The fish was really yummy, but for me, the star of the night was the filet mignon!  Overall, a very nice time . . . I will definitely be back.  Oh, and I saw that some other yelpers had some Andre Agassi sightings here ... as did I.  Must be a favorite spot of his or something.

69fokbDSGHMKD_URs3B6dg.text: Let me preface by saying that I am completely obsessed with finding the freshest fish and truly appreciate quality.  I had the $55 omakase and was pleased.  Some courses were absolutely outstanding and others were just OK.  I told the sushi chef to serve me the good stuff but I am not sure if that comment mattered since nearly all of the meal came from the kitchen.  The least disappointing course was the sushi!  Tuna was the biggest disappointment in that there was no flavor.  It's a good deal but it just doesnt compare to the top restaurants in LA.

QiZHD4r0g1LgtVzrbymBPQ.text: Came back on the 5/22 and everything lived up to our expectations. It was my brother and fathers first time at Sen and Japan and it will not be their last. This is our spot when we come to Vegas for business or travel.

DIZWMwiEW-onKZFK52ixfA.text: After countless dinners composed of only sushi/sashimi at Sen, I'm happy to report that the hot side of this kitchen is equally fantastic. The soft-shell crab special; the black cod marinated in soy; the pan-fried yellowtail; and the grilled calamari atop roasted shisito peppers.... HEAVEN. Of course, you can't resist Chef Shinji's creations and I specially asked for their Japanese Snapper done two ways (LOVE the red wine reduction). For the first time, I had one of their specialty rolls (tuna and shrimp with an excellent curry sauce on top) and was floored. Bravo, Sen, for another excellent meal.

MmJ_zgj3ScUYuybqga-8Iw.text: Love, love, love......the bar chef was awesome I listen to his suggestions and order it, it was a very nice surprise every cent was so worth it!

PH-oyeG-yFAII3cZPPjwmQ.text: Sen is hands down my favorite sushi place in Vegas. The fluke is my favorite and they have some really good scallop sashimi. The sushi rice is perfect which is the ultimate test of a sushi place. The miso soup is by far the best and the shishito peppers are tasty. They have a large list of rolls and if you want a roll that is not on the menu they will make you a custom one. They do some interesting specials, I have tried jellyfish with jalapeno  which was good. And if not everyone at the table likes sushi they also have some great chicken and steak dishes. They do happy hour after 10pm and are open until after 1am.   I am extremely picky when it comes to sushi and I dislike most places, but Sen never disappoints. They are nothing like your average neighborhood sushi joint. Don't let the people who have given negative reviews effect you trying this place.

TrB21d7Ie_B_XP6mPIhxhQ.text: This is the best place in las vegas to get sushi! Better then any sushi place on the strip as well. Must sit at bar for the best service

RTFR18qu_sFdSJTf1ugqMQ.text: Everything here is solid.  Just make sure you get the shrimp with orange aioli appetizer every time you come here...you can thank me later  =)

f07HIvV2_0-V9CiRv7TLRw.text: Great sushi spot by my house.  Its NOT AYCE sushi their prices are much reasonable then strip spots.  They offer a happy hour menu at 10:30!

3KkUORqMusnMlyfsZBWJyw.text: I read the reviews for this restaurant and decided to ask the sushi chef for suggestions. He didn't give anything other than plain sushi - no great eyes-popping-out-of-my-head surprises. My husband ordered a chicken dish and it was half mushrooms (we thought it would only have just a few mushrooms), so he left quite hungry. Disappointing.

bn8a8-MlXD_jwaaW7P1Zyw.text: This is a local hangout for the best neo-JAPANESE $ can buy!  Try and order the Omakasa!  It's something like a 7 course meal literally called "chef's choice".  The food is AMAZING!  The staff is friendly and attentive.  Even if fish is not your thing, go and try their steaks. Finally, don't forget to order their choc soufflet with homemade green tea icecream.  YK

Q0hmds6p1TcbY88ooff2mQ.text: Nobu quality sushi without Nobu prices. Had a fantastic experience sushi experience here. Highly recommended!

_t82Zt8gRj4aAx9sz94ivg.text: WOW! One of the best service I have ever experienced in my life! our server name was Nina, and she rocks! The ambiance at this place is great and defiantly a great place for business or an elegant night! This place is clean and has a great vibe, I will defiantly be coming back and spreading the word around town for this awesome sushi place!

-ze9mMtmGZQk0QoFqehFdA.text: Gourmet sushi that can get the reluctant sushi diners to try raw fish.  You can get the traditional sushi if your hardcore, but if you want to try something different, they put a spin on the sushi with different sauces and garnishes.  I can't recall all the variations I sampled, but I do know it was good.  They have a black cod appetizer on the menu that is a must try.

yIhpOVQUv-Y_LyJ6S68AHQ.text: Love love love Sen of Japan.  The fish is the best in town and the rice really makes the sushi perfect.  It is the best sushi restaurant we have ever been to and we like to eat sushi a lot.  The staff work as a team and help each other out.  Great restaurant.

FOWCePDFLIiKcI-RU5CIJg.text: if you are looking for great Japanese food but can't afford Nobu, this is the place to be. The chef actually is from Nobu. I had the $50 omakase (a course meal) and every dish was del.icio.us and beautiful. And one of the waitresses there was hella cute and friendly.

eVckKt8Sjh32AshBQ1gwAQ.text: If you're looking for an off the strip sushi place with "off the hook" taste this is the place to go.  I went to this place for the first time about 2 weeks ago and I was absolutely elated with how fresh the fish was! The smell of the restaurant was perfect not like some sushi places you walk into (The Ka in Henderson was disappointing in that area).   I try to eat sushi at least once a week if not more and this place will be on my "A" list of sushi places to go. The variety of custom sauces that are prepared with every dish is excellent. Atmosphere is good, the chefs are very friendly, and whether you have your own favorite custom dish or something recommended I don't think you'll be disappointed.    And yes, these chefs who own the place used to work at Nobu and the sushi restaurant inside Bellagio (can't remember the name).

2r_LlHmyzithDi962raGgg.text: I'm confused, how does this restaurant not have a solid 5 star rating.  Hands down the best sushi I have eaten.  I'm from NY and have eaten in many high end sushi bars in NYC.  This place is far superior to any other sushi bar in the country.  If you haven't tried it, you must!  Prices are high but worth every penny.

ORA_Rx9b6_TczHWpPc9bqw.text: This is the best sushi place I have been to in vegas, granted I have not been to any outrageous strip places.    First off the fish here is fantastic, I was taking the advice of the 3 chefs and trying nigiri that I thought I didn't like from other times I tried it and I was blown away, "no no no, you will like it, it's not fishy like you had before it's very fresh, just came in today".  Everything I ate was on the suggestions of the chefs, except one spicy tuna roll (great) I ate as filler, it was all superb.    Second off the rice was perfect, it has that perfect balance of sticking together just enough until you bite it, when it bursts apart in your mouth.  The seasoning was spot on for me, just sweet enough so you can taste it but not overwhelming.    Third off, THE SERVICE WAS HANDS DOWN THE BEST SERVICE I HAVE HAD IN A SUSHI RESTAURANT.  I always hear about this fantasy world where you have a local sushi bar where you have a relationship with the chef, he gives you the best stuff they have, you trust him to serve you, and you like it.  In reality every time in the past when I have asked what is fresh today I get back, "It's all fresh", bull crap!  Well folks I found it, literally everyone i saw at the bar knew the chefs and the chefs knew them.  A regular group came in for a birthday and sat at the bar and said, "wow" me and take your time.  Even by the time I left all the chefs knew my name and visa versa.  This place is legit,  I was handed mackerel nigiri that was sauced and had some garnish and he told me "no soy sauce".  I mean thats fuking awesome, I am not mad because I don't like being told what or how to eat.  You go to a good sushi bar to have a chef prepare you food, not just for food (make sense?).  In other terms, don't fuk around, he knows more than you do so do what he says, you will thank HIM for it.  Go to this place for fish not rolls.  If you order cal roll and shrimp temp roll and some other roll crap with cream cheese covered in eel and ponzu sauce and dunk it in a bowl of wasabi with a splash of soy sauce this place isn't going to stand out in my opinion.  For that type of thing selection is key as long the fish is pretty good.  The prices here are a little steep to be eating fried cream cheese monstrosities.    Nigiri 5-7  Basic rolls 6-8  Special rolls 12-14

DOoJrrsqGzZN2FqzvllKnQ.text: Love love this place. Delicious food and great service. Everything was fresh and high quality. We had the Omakase and lots off the menu items suggested/ordered by our waiter such as fatty tuna aka otoro straight from Japan, yellowtail, snapper, etc. It is off the strip but totally worth the drive if you're a sushi lover.

YYkxZfazYBNwgz9M62ovpQ.text: My initial experience here is when it first opened in 2005 and I have forgotten how fantastic this place is. Like all the other reviews for this place, I have to agree that the Nobu style is clearly evident in their cuisine. Miso cod! You simply have to have this dish. I had the beef tataki here and it was excellent. The tasting menu is some thing that first timers must have. Food, price, service and atmosphere, this place will not let you down.  Sen of Japan gives Nobu a good run for it's money.

CRVWMWs08iS-BV_vx3PMog.text: We celebrated our anniversary at Sen of Japan. We had one $55 and  one $85 omasake dinner. All of the courses were great. We'll definitely be back. To top it all off we were seated next to Andre Agassi and Stefi Graf.

0hyfsqdLc58drABuetAK7A.text: Truthfully this restaurant would be rated at 3.5 stars, but the service we received from the chef moved it back up to 4 stars.  We had the $55 omakase each... Started with the yellowtail sashimi, very flavorful, and a great start....then we had sashimi salad with garlic ponzu, it was okay, not an item that stood out...next we had black cod soy, which was a split decision between my love and I... it had a slimey texture for him, while I enjoyed it...i think it had a good balance with the sweetness and the miso...the filet mignon was decent, but I think I'm a bit spoiled with steak, hence I might be an unfair judge, its decent, but not something I'd eat again at this restuarant...the final dish that came out was a dish of assorted nigiri sushi with two pieces of tuna roll at the end... i think out of all the dishes we had, this was the most disasppointing, the wasabi under the fish for the nigiri was a bit too heavy, which would of been okay if it was fresh made wasabi like Kagaya in LA, but it wasn't, therefore it was just a overpowering addition to the sushi..  The fish overall, I would rate it around a 3.5, since good tuna melts in your mouth, and salmon should be sweet without any other additional sauces for flavoring, hence why they only received 3.5 stars for the fish....  FOOD = 3.5 stars FOOD & Service = 4 stars, the chefs were definitely fun to chit chat with...

ZJ5fTxipE1AD4Awdm_N6aQ.text: Tell your server that you're new and would like for them to choose a few dishes for you. Everything on the menu is wonderful, so they won't steer you wrong. The dishes are AUTHENTIC japanese cuisine, made by japanese sushi-dons that have been training for decades. The flavor pairings are unique and distinctly different from any other sushi joint I've been to.  Best sushi I've had in my life--and trust me, I've probably tried over a hundred restaurants all over the world and for the money, this tops them all. I'm sure there are a few hoity-toity places with slightly better atmosphere, but those super high end dishes are triple the price. For the quality of food, this place is priced reasonably well.  The sushi is incredible. You MUST try this place!

MjG7KzfBAUFhZbUout6FKg.text: Black cod lettuce wraps, calamari with Jalepano, garlic yellowtail sashimi, and Bubbies green tea and lychee mochi.  We stumbled on this place after Yelping, and it doesn't disappoint. The staff is great, and sit at the sushi bar for the best service, and great suggestions!

FAm2rUSOkgKvLp6rAKLgMg.text: Makes me do my happy dance :-) Try the  soy miso black cod

fFzz0K5VVAUbbLtc0aF-Ow.text: Nice omakase dinner off the Strip. The service is great and fish is good. I was a little disappointed in the lack of variety of fish we got and for $80, it was not particularly good value. I think I might go a la carte if I went back there, but not being a local, I'm not it's worth the drive time from the Strip.

-3LhsnOKj3qvTAdK8RBAag.text: After reading the reviews here, I was quite excited to go. My experience was probably lackluster at best however.. I'm not exactly a novice to sushi either, having enjoyed the most fresh sashimi from Japan.   I went with my boyfriend on a Saturday night and assuming that it would be quite busy, we made a reservation at 7. When we got there (which was at least 10 minutes before 7), we saw a group of three without a reservation get their seats before us. The more infuriating part is that we had to wait for 15-20 minutes to get a seat even though we had a reservation!! It was pretty priceless to see the faces of the waiters when they realized that they had sat a group without a reservation before us, but they did nothing about it.   The service went downhill from there. It was almost laughable how poor the service was. We had to ask several times to just refill our water once. The wait for each dish was about 30 minutes each, which is absolutely unacceptable in my opinion, especially when you are waiting for sashimi dish that was so small! I have seen better sushi chefs cut bigger, more professional, and fresher pieces of fish that filled a plate 5x bigger than that size in 15 minutes.   As for the food, I will say that it was not horrible but it was not great either. We had cod lettuce wraps (taken off the menu now but they said they still made them) because my boyfriend raved about them. I thought that they were just okay. There was a crunchy topping reminiscent of fish bones that made the whole dish pretty unpleasant...   The other dish we had (which I cannot remember the name exactly because their website does not work..) was tempura with orange slices and mushrooms. I found the combination to be absolutely revolting and hard to swallow. I consider myself to be very open about eating strange foods (i.e. will eat anything), but for a dish that was not even that strange, this was just gross.   Overall, I think this place is extremely overpriced, especially for poor service and just okay food. I think the idea of this restaurant is pretty good but put into action, not so much.

2U1L7RPalRiJhL5Ve2AxPA.text: These guys are great.  The food is great and the service is GREAT too!  Highly recommend!  We need more cool places like this in Las Vegas!

KJo9aqfw_i_9q0svA2q89Q.text: I actually went with here with Yusaku S. who reviewed this previously. And My experiences was the same.  FANTASTIC. That waitress WAS hella cute and nice. Alice was her name I believe.  I think she was just into Yusaku and maybe thats why we got such good service.  I'll have to go again on my own to confirm what I will conclude in this review.  Go to Sen of Japan if you want nobu for half the price and a tenth the pretentiousness.

9-CjYcYHxwzALqqz-izbiQ.text: Must go!!!  This is a great spot in Vegas, some of the best sushi I've had in town. treat as a high end dinner date or a light pre-club bite. They have great appetizers (fried calamari or lemon shrimp) my favorite is the salmon nigiri! One of the best sushi I've ever had.  The service is always great and highly knowledgeable, which makes navigating a comprehensive sake list really fun.

J0a5j-CAn98FvmThJgDwMg.text: Great find from a day hike to a nice setting to relax from the calico basin loop trail. Great service , great recommendation on sushi and pairing. There was a rush and the manager was amazing on telling us why things were slow. #19 ultimate roll, amazing!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sen of Japan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great bar and great service

RI2sMaZSIem2rBhXbqt8hQ.text: Favorite sushi place in town! Love the black cod lettuce wrap! The fluke with truffle and spicy salmon is amazing! Don't forget the passion fruit cocktail and the pineapple dessert! You really can't go wrong with anything off their menu always the best quality!

5k6qbZ1WbRMyhYvygWfPaQ.text: My boyfriend & I have been coming here for abt 4 months now & sen of japan never disappoints. The service is always excellent & the servers are very knowledgeable abt the menu. Favorites are the salmon carpaccio & filet mignon tataki; both are amazing and the filet melts in your mouth. The new heirloom tomato salad is new and awesome; duck tataki, salmon skin roll, & the lamb are also great! I want to try everything on the menu.

ZO3NLMh3t-NpPnkdJVWRUg.text: Sen of Japan, I'm in love with you! I'm never disappointed with my dinner and every time I try something new I love it. The servers are amazing and are very knowledgable when it comes to making food and sake suggestions.  I've done the omakase a few times, and let me tell you, DELICIOUS! The fish here is pretty damn fresh, the best sushi you can get off the strip. They definitely know what they are doing here.

jB-uPhzWJXDohLjHBQwn2A.text: If you are looking for a good sushi experience off the strip, with good service Sen of Japan is great place to go. I was pleased with my selections and they were very attentive  Hand cut spicy tuna roll for starters is great!

ijlS37Da3pfK2yqlUZ4_0w.text: Our sashimi was very fresh, and prepared in ways I am used to seeing in NYC.  Fluke fin was fantastic, as was everything else we had.  As one diner commented, the quantities were small, but delicious.  Considering the restaurant was about half full when we arrived, the prep time was very fast.  We tried the green tea creme brulee, and it was delicious!  We will definitely return again soon.  The place is a bit noisy due to hard surfaces, but once we adjusted to it, we were fine.

UZKLccL9X3Y5zKIl0WvN3g.text: I want to go back here just to have Jennifer as my waitress again! Definitely the best service I've ever had. Jennifer is really accommodating and took care of everything for our first time! The sashimi and nigiri were absolutely the best I've ever had, I also enjoyed everything Jennifer recommended to us!

3WCqoaTyfxavuoUuoef6AA.text: Sen really is as good as it gets.  The fish is fresh, the rice is warm, the staff attentive.  Get: mixed carpaccio, fluke with truffle oil, garlic yellowtail, negihama handroll, agadashi tofu, mixed sashimi, and get the toro, always the toro!  Add a carafe of sake. Perfect.

OhfKI839l-Z8diLbgm5w5w.text: My boyfriend and I visit Vegas at least twice a year.  Last time was a few months ago and we were craving sushi.  Didn't feel like paying exorbitant prices on the strip so we yelped and up came Sen of Japan.   The two of us started out ordering sushi (Nigiri mostly) off the menu and then we decided to switch over to Omakase (This is when you leave it up to the sushi chef as to what he serves you) which was the best decision!!  We didn't want any  food from the kitchen so we had the option of Nigiri or Sashimi and were able to switch it up between courses.   We were served approx 5 pieces of Nigiri or Sashimi for each round and the plates were presented so beautifully with simple and complex flavors (fingerling limes, red wine vinaigrette, yuzu ponzu, etc) .  There was even an order in which to eat the sushi.  Our taste buds experienced something truly magical that night.  We have never had flavor profiles like that and the experience was like nothing else we have experienced.  The fish was also very fresh.    Prices were extremely reasonable!! I'd even say cheap!  This will be a staple on every Vegas Trip.  You locals are so lucky to have this place nearby!

zZJ12erDikOhYm7RyR0iEQ.text: Came here for Mother's Day meal & it was perfect. Had the 6 course omakase menu & it was delicious! The service is great & every dish was on point. True authentic original Japanese flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Sen of Japan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dishes from the omakase menu!

HfCJSgSEALf2IO46ZXkoqA.text: I tried their happy hour few month ago. It was nice atmosphere and fresh food.  Taste good, good place to have a date.  If you want to have light sushi dinner, go this place !

za4FF8BhtJK_qFPyIcX7gw.text: The food, service and ambiance or this place were all amazing.  We came with a large party of 10 for a celebration and pretty much ordered every single thing on the menu (that's a LOT).  Chicken on a Stick - fabulous.  The Soft Shell Crab with Spicy Tuna Sushi, Main Lobster Sushi (I don't even see that on their online menu), and Avocado Sushi are probably now my favorite things in the world (in that order).  Oysters were fabulous (and so were those little fruits that were served on the ice with them).  Lamb Chops - Amazing.  Shrimp Tempura - woah.  Grilled Fish collar was melt in your mouth delicious.  Everything else we ate was all out of this world even when I wasn't sure exactly what it was...  The ONLY thing we had that was subpar was the tuna on tuna sushi roll - but that was probably just because it was just a little too tuna-ey.  We also had every desert - The Green Tea Creme Brulee brought a tear to my eye for being so tasty (I LOVE creme brulee).  The long-wait Chocolate Souffle and (Almond) Cake? were totally worth waiting for.  The little ice cream pockets (that come from Hawaii) are delicious.  Service was very friendly and helpful.  They wouldn't stop asking us if we wanted more!  We racked up over a $1,000 bill with LOTS of hot and cold saki and bottles of wine to go around (maybe why I'm a little hazy on the names of all of the delicious dishes I tasted).  Totally worth it.

P7iGKdvub_DrCO2H4TmOKw.text: The Skinny: so-so sushi and incorrectly cut sashimi (2.5) service is shamelessly trying to upcharge you and ignore you when you don't feel like playing along(1) value: given the fact that I've been to Korean sushi joints that served similar product, their outrageous prices do not match the quality of the food. (2)  My hubs and I came here about 2 years ago to sample their Valentine's Day omakase. Although there did appear to be a lot of cooked items, the quality of the food was enough to make us contemplate coming here again last week.  We arrived with a friend for some good eats but were disappointed on many levels.  First of all, the service is highly lacking. Our waitress had the annoying habit of always trying to get us to order more expensive items on the menu. No, we do not want a miniscule bowl of edamame you want to charge $4.50 for when I can get a massive bag of it for less than $2. No, we do not want to order alcoholic drinks. No, we don't want any of your appetizers.  After we kept politely declining her suggestions, she pretty much ignored us until she wanted to us to clear the bill. Which was frustrating because she didn't even bring out a bowl of rice that came with our meager meals. Not to mention that they removed our small plates when our food came out.   Let me tell you, it feels totally ghetto eating out of their massive sashimi bowl because you are likely to drip soy sauce on the other pieces of fish.   Not cool. Not zen. All ghetto. Sorry, but it had to be said.  Enough about the shoddy service. More on the food.  Our friend and I ordered the Sashimi Special Combination ($29.95) while the hubby got the Shin's Special Plate ($19.95).  For $19.95, the only special about Shin's Special Plate is how epic a rip it is. Although beautifully presented, the fish texturally, lack the firmness of really fresh product. The size of the fish on the nigri was also on the thinner side. Although the seasoning of the various fish was varied, the pairing of flavors were only okay in my books. Nothing terribly innovative. And for 7 pieces of nigri, it is very expensive.  The sashimi special combination (sashimi plate, bowl of rice, miso soup) for $29.95 is also very expensive for what it was. The thin slices, the small portion size left me very disappointed. Top it off with fish that wasn't the finest quality (I went on a Thursday - no excuses!), I cannot recommend this dish to anyone.  Overall, it's disappointing because there are very few decent sushi joints in town. But between the shoddy service, the lackluster fish quality and the skimpy portions, this place gets a 2 star.

photos.caption: Photo of Sen of Japan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef&#39;s special nigiri platter -$19.95
Photo of Sen of Japan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi combination select - $29.95

I0GWPveHVegeVQWw02Q4pA.text: Sushi is my favorite type of food, sashimi in particular. What I love about Sen of Japan is the portion of the seafood. Seasoned deliciously. No soy sauce necessary which in my opinion if you have to dip your sushi in soy sauce then you're cheapening the taste and looking to enhance the taste of your sushi.   Sen of Japan, by far is the best sushi restaurant in Vegas that has a high end taste.

5ho_eNjaj97_ni-V8_xjbw.text: Excellent sushi rolls. We had the spicy tuna, the spicy salmon, and the crab and tuna rolls.  They were each excellent. We also had the chocolate souffle which was made fresh for us for dessert. Fun restaurant that we recommend.

y-OX7WkX2F--OgwK0OES3Q.text: This is my favorite place for sushi! Every dish is so tasty and fresh! There are many choices in Las Vegas - and this is hands down a great restaurant that always comes through!

EW1oL6ak-a3Z3GREnEChfQ.text: I just had some really good sushi and I had to share. I took some advice from my fellow yelpers and started out with black cod soy, the fish cut like butter, so tender, not a huge fan of ponzu sauce, but I still enjoyed it. The absolute, most amazing thing I started out with was the garlic yellowtail. When I tell you it was the freshest, most delightful piece of fish I'm not making it up. I have been thinking about it since I left the place.   I have to also give a special shout out to our server, Kayla, who was training, but you would have never been able to tell because she was excellent!! We told her we would let her pick our rolls with the only request of NO cream cheese (who eats cream cheese on sushi)? She picked the most amazing rolls,   Shrimp tempura mango inside Real crab mango cucumber Large wild shrimp tempura with apple and inariage, I know it sounds crazy, but please try this roll! And another one that wasn't on the menu, I believe it was called the ultimate yellowtail. So darn good!   Service here was outstanding! I can't wait to come back!

kJ_yONOpbgyFsggZoklntQ.text: Fantastic service and wonderful fresh fish.  Try the chefs specials as they are creative and much more enjoyable than the typical rolls and sushi that you find in an average Japanese restaurant.

ofKv8pmeyUhRrQxwfsoxXg.text: The best sushi in Vegas! It's such a gem of a place and the fish is always fresh and delicious! Incredible variety on the menu and fantastic staff! Our faves are the crispy rice tuna app, garlic hamachi, salmon with orange sauce. You can't go wrong though!

3v5emGIqA7YslWmZVI2DZA.text: First off I'd like to say this restaurant is wonderful with the customer service! I don't live in Vegas but when I come for the weekend I have to stop here for the food! I came a few days ago to celebrate my birthday. The person who helped us was very friendly and welcoming. I forget to ask her name the few times I've been! But anyways she's very helpful and answered my questions when I'm curious about a dish. At Sen of Japan I love how the servers explains what's on the dish as they bring out the food for us. The restaurant is about a 15 20 minutes drive from the strip which isn't bad at all if you want delicious sushi! The last times that I've gone I'd never had to wait. I was greeted and seated immediately! I've got to say this is by far the best sushi restaurant in Vegas! I highly recommend this place! :)

cNAovV50hYUz5hlVIdroDg.text: I've probably had this place bookmarked for at least two years and kept forgetting to check it out. My friends and I were across the street getting coffee and then decided sushi sounded like a great idea.  Everything here was amazing. I got mackerel sashimi with ginger and wasabi on it, smoked salmon and blue fin sushi, friends got sweet potato tempura, unagi roll, salmon sashimi, and fluke sashimi with truffle oil.  Really wish I came here sooner and definitely plan on doing the omakase next time I'm around and have a big appetite. Chill atmosphere, and lots of variety on the menu if you want to cap yourself at a specific price point or go ham.

HINT: go to the back 2 pages on their menu to get the "cut" style traditional sushi you are all use to. The last dish of the night I had was the "Spicy Crunch Roll"... OMFG!!! Delicious.  Great staff.  Everyone was perfect. 2 people can eat for about $60. Depending how hungry you are. I LOVE Sushi so I can eat.

LOtpe6l2R7I9m7SHR7k5NQ.text: One of the most enjoyable dining experiences thus far. Food, presentation, service, ambience, all of superb quality. If you visit, I hope Tamayo (I hope I'm not butchering her name) takes care of your table because she truly understands the art of excellent service.  Recomendation: order Omakase special, and prepare to have the food experience you'll remember Vegas for. This is the type of place you want to recommend to the friends you actually like.

DXPF70OqJgFdtQdmiXKbag.text: I was very let down !!! It took an  hour to get our food. Once we got our food it was extremely gross. It was soggy. Tasted like it had just been sitting in the back. The food was so bad that it made me sick. I couldn't even eat it. WILL NEVER GO BACK !!! Avoid this place. #shouldhavegonetokumi

bV23uUQuWoO9FZEXxsnYow.text: Best sushi quality!! but SAD just because they are out of the oyster :/ but vibes wise is good! Server staff are nice too!! definitely come back again!!

dkVTxQSeXTe-ECjtjfKyEw.text: Some of the BEST sushi I have had in a long time + somehow also the cheapest (came at happy hour) = very happy customer  I have nothing bad to say about this place. Super pleased.

iwqFuUSOEtZX4uppjrVMAw.text: Wow wow wow!  I never start my reviews like this, but this is officially one of the most delicious sushi restaurants I have ever eaten in.  First, it was my birthday and I was running late for my reservation, I called and changed my reservation but they said it was booked but if I come she will see what she can do.  Worried, I decided to take a chance and went.  Within 1 minute she comes back and says "I have a table, right this way". I was like what? Did this just happen?  Then I was lucky enough to get the manger to be my waiter and every time I ordered I honestly told him to surprise me.  He brought a few things from the menu and a few from off the menu.  And boy,  nothing disappointed me.  This was the freshest sushi I have ever had in Vegas.  I recommend this place 100%.  Great food great service, great customer service.   I left 5 stars....let's just pretend it's 7 stars!  Go try it! Bon appetit!

kzXhUez_p3lIOPJXD0XVJQ.text: Great Japanese food and extremely consistent service! My family's favorite is the Age-dashi tofu, seared garlic shrimp sushi, and tempura. The food has been consistently good since 2016 and I will definitely continue to visit for good Japanese food.

JtSzG7W08UaI4Z0eqZYThA.text: Atmosphere is nice. The sushi chefs were really great. Great quality fish. I had the sashimi and I enjoyed every bite. We also got a California roll, caterpillar roll and another with snow crab. Also liked the iced green tea

tnfOuX1ygq4-JiW6h8pfmQ.text: The atmosphere of this place is great! The service was mostly great, and the food was delicious. However, I think this restaurant is overpriced. We ordered the veggie combination and was sad when we got one piece of veggie each. I mean, veggies are fairly cheap. We also ordered the Sashimi combination. The fish quality was good, but the cuts were not. They were almost paper thin. A little disappointed with the cuts.  Our waitress was very pleasant. I even asked her a question about the tea and she went and found out and came back with a fun fact for the table. That was awesome. (She gets 5 stars) We also ordered the special shrimp balls, that was delicious. As well as the calamari. That was ok. Little disappointed as we thought we were going to get jalapeno dipping sauce, but rather we just got ponzu instead. :/ We ordered desert, which was delicious... but... we waited 20 minutes for it. It took them longer to do desert than our entire meal! So, that was a little frustrating.  The food was a little overpriced for the amount that you get. We think we will try somewhere else next time.

VFKVLCqod0NTMQcmYRLqFA.text: This restaurant is small but worth the wait if there is one and has super friendly staff. We ordered the salted edamame and it was perfect, miso soup was good and the filet minion was to die for. Seriously it melted in our mouths! I wanted to order another but dinner was also very pricey!! I got the orange shrimp because the photos and reviews were so good, it's a tempura shrimp in an orange sauce with few mushrooms and a few mandarin oranges.   Everything was so yummy. I really don't mind paying well for delicious food and I'll be back. I'd be back every night if money wasn't an issue!! For dessert we had mochi and some bubble tea from just a little walk away.   Great staff and great food. Can't wait to return.

vAjaUaej19m5LC-6Po_-ig.text: One of most amazing dining experiences of my life. It was made extra special by our waitperson Rick. He educated us about the sake and food menus and told us of his favorites and made excellent suggestions. Now sorry to say but I am not a sushi enthusiast, but my Bae told me the quality of the fish was exceptional.   We started our meal with Shishito peppers and black cod with lettuce. Two great choices. My Seafood Toban with the assortment of fish in a delicious sauce was served sizzling. Not a morsel was left on our plates. To top the meal off Rick suggested this delicious warm almond cream puff style pastry with vanilla ice cream. Had to stop myself from licking the plate.   I seriously suggest this restaurant if you have a love of sushi or cooked Japanese food. It truly rivals any place on the strip.

aIaVGVahU65IJMrpgFTtGw.text: We've been 4 times in 2.5 months.  The sushi is quality.  Our favorite is the Black Cod entree and the Black Cod lettuce wraps.  The service is welcoming and not over bearing.  They have a good selection of premium Sake.  We'll be back!

wrp-HZbGLI5M_ZYa91RMJA.text: If you're in the mood for a fancier dinner with some novel dishes, then Sen is a good option. Their basic sushi rolls aren't a particularly good deal, but I've been impressed when I've ordered specials. It's not a cheap option but it can be a good one.

nNFQ_jcHgfVsUNINSJgFlw.text: We were in search of an authentic sushi bar where they serve high  quality fresh omasake menu owned by a Japanese sushi chef but knew that none would exist on the vegas strip.  After all, Vegas isn't exactly known for sushi.  I found Sen of Japan on Yelp and noticed their high rating from 60 reviewers and voted as the best sushi restaurant in Vegas by Zagat.   Well, worth the try!!    This place is around 10 minutes away from the Vegas strip.  We sat on the sushi bar and ordered the Omakase.  Our sushi chef's name was Sunny.  I would have to give him 5 stars for excellent service.  He was very attentive and worked quickly to serve not just our dinner but also the orders he had to full fill from other customers.     The sashimi were all nicely plated and were topped with different garish on each fish.  The layout of every dish was so pretty but the taste was even better.  I loved the way they prepared the rice where it was perfectly moist and wet.  Some places gives you a glob of dry rice that ruins the whole experience.    Omasake was $55-$85 per person depending on how much you wanted to eat.  I was full when I reached the $55 mark.  After the last toro fish, I felt content.    LA offers higher quality sushi places but for being Vegas, it was good enough for me to rate them at least 4 stars.    If I were in Vegas again, I'd come back here. If you're sick of all those typical hotel buffets, go try Sen of Japan.  I don't recommend ANY sushi restaurant on the strip.  Those are catered to non asian customers who don't know the difference between sushi or sashimi and are content with previously  frozen fish.

photos.caption: Photo of Sen of Japan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sen of Japan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sen of Japan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oo-3ANEq7PabjuQ9tZfFTw.text: Sen of Japan was good...but not great! I had high expectations, but I left a bit disappointed. The goods! Calamari Jalapeno Salsa: yelp.com/biz_photos/sen-... This was a yummy combination with a little bit of spice. The salsa on here was great, and made me eat a lot of the greens lol. It was tender Calamari, but the salsa made the dish. Fried Shrimp with Orange Aioli Sauce! yelp.com/biz_photos/sen-... This was great...shrimp were cooked perfectly, and the sauce (albeit a bit sweet) was flavorful and zesty. This was one of my favorites of the night, although it was a bit sweet for my tastes.. still very enjoyable! Nigiri is good here : yelp.com/biz_photos/sen-... Fresh cuts of fish, with small amounts of dressing and flavors added...not just plain nigiri. Edamame was good but very simple : yelp.com/biz_photos/sen-... The bads Fresh Water Eel Roll : yelp.com/biz_photos/sen-... This was just ok...the eel was cut fairly thin, so it was hard to find it in there. Rice was a tad overdone, and it was a very forgetful dish. Haven't had mediocre sushi for a while...but that's what this was Lava Cake with Green Tea ice cream : yelp.com/biz_photos/sen-... I made the mistake of ordering it after we were done eating, so there was a 15min wait or so...but when I cut into it, no "lava!" It was overcooked....and the ice cream wasn't very flavorful either. Huge bummer after waiting for that long....plus, it wasn't on the happy hour menu, so I think it was a solid $7-8 down the tube. And lastly, the price. I spent almost $40 + tip on a Happy Hour menu with no drinks by myself...and since I wasn't blown away on most of the food, I didn't get the bang for the buck ratio I prefer. I would have rather went to that new "fusion" place and spent half the money, or an AYCE sushi spot and fill up on the good stuff for again...less money.

photos.caption: Photo of Sen of Japan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lava Cake with Green Tea ice cream. 15min wait for an overcooked choco cake...no lava here!  :(
Photo of Sen of Japan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The nigiri here have a slight fusion aspect to it, with chef adding light garnishes and sauces. Good tastes &amp; not distracting.
Photo of Sen of Japan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Water Eel Roll. This was just ok...the eel was cut fairly thin, so it was hard to notice. Rice was a tad overdone too

2etUuWb0zsQcYd2Ymz4dRA.text: Best Sushi Restaurant that I've EVER been to! DELICIOUS sushi & great service. If you're there when Nick (general manager) is working, he makes some great recommendations.

6CjKmzt6elR9VFfFimgBRw.text: Wife and kids loves it; I'm not a fan of sushi or sashimi, so I had soba with tempura. Rachel shared a couple of sushi with me; oddly enough, my favorite part of sushi is the shoyu sauce and wasabe!

HQC8lC2uYEU1_w2EPSQriA.text: I dont see what the fuss is over.   So in a city with a sushi restaurant as commonly seen as a Starbucks you would have to be extraordinary to stand apart. With so many reviews of high praises had me highly anticipating this meal, and at the end of it i thought WTF. The dining room isnt anything fancy at all, its actually not even warm or inviting in any way. I can say that service is super attentive, and they are knowledgeable of the menu so a star for that. But when it comes down to the actual food, although it was good it simply wasnt anything that made me want to return. Especially after the $120 bill for 2, when i could have went to any number of spots and eaten for half that and felt the same way after my meal. Having a combination of both the rolls, and their signature sashimi and nigiri with special sauces. Its different of course with combinations like Salmon w/ Orange Miso, or Scallop with Spicy Lime Dressing, but different doesnt always mean better and i think thats True in this case. I read that rolls with mango were a must, and we tried a few of them but id say only one of them really "worked" well together. Toward the end of the meal i found myself ordering a final roll in the more traditional offering because all the weird sauces etc didnt do it for me.  If your looking to get away from the more traditional sushi offerings with weird sauces, unique ingredient combos, etc then sure come on by, but expect to drop a decent amount of cash on the bill. But if you enjoy sushi because of the taste, texture and quality of the actual fish and preparation that doesnt taka away from that then go elsewhere. I will not return.

v07ywLPPd80-oxnkgJp9Ug.text: Nothing  met expectations.... Mushy udon... Nothing was good .... Nothing was terrible... Just sub par everything. Tempura was ok... Raw vegetables though.... Everything was just not good.......

photos.caption: Photo of Sen of Japan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi bar looks nice

9OPkTIoGW59uZjGhEwGPaQ.text: Well deserved 5 stars! The food along with the customer service was outstanding! It was so good, I went there 3 times in one week. Once during normal business hours and twice during happy hour. The sushi is fresh and the dishes are really created with quality ingredients. I highly recommend the cold soba noodles and the salmon carpaccio. The yellowtail nigiri is absolutely delicious and fresh! Their happy hour is really good and super cheap for what they offer; it's from 10:30pm-1:30am. Our waitress was extremely friendly and was great with recommendations and was very accommodating to our needs, very impressed! I will return and recommend to all my friends for sure.

EqmR6aE3v6S_ytTZu4_7JA.text: Outstanding. Great flavors.  They unique combinations that you can't get anywhere else. Highly recommended.

qDiImGlrh0fT5Jgx_NjWRQ.text: Until I'd gone to Sen of Japan, I'd only experienced a certain level of sushi. Now I know that there is a next level.  The texture of the fish on the nigiri that we ordered was mind-blowing. I had no idea that sushi could take on this kind of texture or flavor.  The rolls that have the chef's specialty sauces are unique and flavorful. I enjoyed the chili lime sauce nigiri that I ordered.  The wait staff was attentive, formal, and informative. Just what you would want out of a classy restaurant.

krnVllx6WAO8H6NYZqlcCw.text: YOU HAVE TO TRY ONE OF THEIR MANGO ROLLS!!! They have a few rolls with mango on top and they are EXTREMELY delicious!!  Me & hubby love the cod lettuce wraps as well. Fish has always been really fresh every time we eat here. Also the chefs are really clean. I sat at the bar and watched our chef wash his hands like every 5 minutes.

qLK4yKOT1H4yHwaCxXIXNQ.text: A great getaway from the crowds, smoke, craziness and the prices on the Strip.  This place is located in a quiet residential mini-mall, a 15 minute drive from all the action.   It is a popular place and you may have to wait in line on weekends. Great place to meet locals. The service was top notch as was the food but of course you'd expect that from a world-class chef.  I wanted to try the Kobe beef udon with foie gras but it wasn't available.  Sen of Japan is the reason you'd want a car in Vegas.

u5nYT8EXjkF891aBV5CHaQ.text: Best Japanese restaurant in town. Period.  Wife is Japanese and I have been all over japan with her eating out too.  Chicken dished were fantastic!

7Dh2P6nZBDx7emp8nyD0WA.text: Lesson learnt : "Sauces do make all the difference!"   And before anything, I'd like to give a shoutout to Veronica and Jo. You guys stupendously rocked! Thank you once again for your delightful company. You have to know that I was stuffed to much contentment, I should probably feel guilty about it. This couple, my fellow yelpers, are buddies from school I've gotten to know better over the months and setting aside any possible bias I have for them, I gotta admit (and you will too if you come here) that Jo is quite the chef!   The night began on a more exotic note: Hawaiian Spicy Edamame, followed by one order of the spider rolls and another of the shrimp tempura rolls. Both were of decent sizes, enough to fill your stomach up halfway. I especially admired that little touch of mango on the spider roll.   And everything only crescendo'd from there. We then had the Calamari with Jalapeno Salt which was 'succulent' - a word I would never have seen myself associate calamari with, fyi - and that's a compliment, because the sauce/topping that was sprinkled on top of each calamari gave it a vinegary taste, a unique alternative to the usual tartar sauce. There was also the mixed seafood with apple vinaigrette although I must swiftly move on to pinpoint the highlight of the night - the Chocolate Souffle with green tea ice-cream. All concerns regarding weight loss and a possible diet regime disappeared as soon as it got to our table, I tell ya! I probably don't even have to go on and speak in awe of this dessert for you to know that Veronica and I loved it to tidbits!   Will definitely keep this restaurant on my list of go-back-tos. It had a cozy atmosphere, dimly lit with candles, perfect for long talks or a cute date night. The staff was very friendly (props to you Kayla) and I couldn't quite forget the lightning tearing up the sky in the background that night - all while we were talking about ghost stories too!   Fancy that.

QfulF6tM-wedyzVfAvkk3Q.text: Best sushi in Vegas, everything on the menu is incredible. Happy hour is amazing deals. Nick is the best server in Vegas. Perfect location, restaurant is awesome, clean, and trendy. Must must must try, best sushi in Vegas.

EIUfR2qUt77-s8NIOB1aVw.text: Service is horrendously slow. We were there last night to have "2" separate food orders to go... after waiting 90 minutes they had COMBINED our orders!! Who in the hell does that?!! Prices are insane for the amount of food you get for i.e 1 pathetic chicken skewer $2.75 ea!. The only reason we had chosen this place is that since it was close to my family's place. Never again

DY4ZMG6iaVV1AJUlRCptCg.text: Sashimi with sake is the best...! Foods are delicious even desserts too. All the services was really good! Specially the guy looks like manager gave us good service.! Also all the chefs are nice:)

Q8EsNyX9NUsNuVNrtGTa_g.text: Disappointed. Not so fresh sashimi. Tasted fishy and warm. Won't be returning. Okay service. Good atmosphere. Just...okay. perhaps other items on menu are better? Not the sashimi.

G46M8_zlW6gS7UUR9WJtxQ.text: Our family's favorite sushi restaurant in town!  Fresh fish from Japan. Everything here is so delicious and delicate and authentic.

Z_zb0ahzT2FJ093Q7nQpDQ.text: My boss took the whole office to this place and it was great i would suggest that if your in Las Vegas to go to Sen of Japan its not that far off the strip

NxxCbiJvg8WmV1JGheCmPw.text: ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS! I will eat here anytime I have some extra funds (as I like the expensive stuff), they're open & I'm near! So fresh! So delicious!! ;)

8Ce5HLrruG-yiK9v0EldXw.text: I needed a stiff drink and I had a craving for good sushi, so I headed to Sen of Japan. After all this is the chef that started Nobu.   I had the "blue" vodka drink, it had sliced cucumber in it and a giant blue ice ball. It was stiff and strong.   I let our chef know about my gluten problem and he made sure that all the pieces we ordered were without soy or were made with the gluten-free soy.   We had the octopus with the truffle oil, it was so delicious, it was served with little micro green and red onion.  Then we had the red snapper in truffle oil too, and this was delectable. We also needed to sample the Santa Barbara oysters, these we're oh so fresh, I don't know how they do it.  We also opted for an assortment of sashimi sushi. These we're salmon, tuna, yellow tail and halibut. All incredibly delicious.   We tried some cooked items too, like the hamachi Kama and the live soft shell crab. The hamachi was buttery and oh so meaty and the crab was lightly powdered in corn starch and deep fried. So delicious.   Will be making Sen of Japan a staple.

KBrJ_4RA1iDCToMKbiwQfw.text: Tasty food, good prices. Some portions, very small; the Agadashi for example only had two Pieces. The rice on the sushi rolls was fresh and warm, always a good test for a Japanese restaurant. Large selection of food. Service was good.

0g0H1EPiT2xS17r0VBC-CQ.text: Service is great!  They do some custom orders but limited.  The quality of fish was pretty good Food came very quickly- that's always nice  Loved the background music The decore is chill   We would come back

L-svGrmdWBjyOv5a4EhDpw.text: Love me some nigiri! My favorite place in town for a chill time with amazing nigiri. The staff is always nice, and the food always fresh. Yoshi, the sushi chef behind the bar has served me before, and he's very kind and attentive to your experience while you're there. He can make great recommendations based on choices you've already made!  I typically like the less additionally flavored sushi. However,  their garlic style for kanpachi and yellowtail nigiri are phenomenal with a hint of spice! The ocean trout with spicy ponzu and the scallop with spicy lime sauce were also very tasty, but had a little bit too much sauce and took away from the fresh fish flavor. I also got the cold soba, which was good, but nothing special; I don't think I'll be ordering that the next time I'm here. I'll definitely have a next time though!

VzXkcYKshOFjKOq9B7JVdg.text: Our favorite sushi spots. The staff is always friendly and the food is always prepared well.

-ohCDA74Ckfy3Zj_JPqvow.text: We ordered chirashi selection which is $35.50. It includes one salmon(split two, also we asked substituted ono to salmon... maybe this is why they split one to two piece) one ebi, one saba, one tamago(splited 2) two regular tuna(almost one piece) one halibut, one aji, one taco, one ika, little bit ikura and one piece shiso. There's no special fish and also it's not worthy as we paid. Maybe I can make chirashi bowl more prettier than their chef... Close places, naked fish, they gave lots of special fish like as blue fin or uni for their chirashi. Service was great! But food is not good as much as the price. We don't recommend this place and we won't come back.

7bvRXivBYDOq3nGo5JjmdQ.text: We did the chef 6 choice Omakase.  This was amazing!  Just as good as nobo!!  Obviously because the chef was a head chef at nobo.   I would recommend you try the Omakase style chef choice.

jJLJRC1_9VkkQV88y3T0Eg.text: Solid sushi spot off the Vegas strip (it's about a 20 minute drive from the strip.  Great quality fish with modern twists, good service, clean decor.  Really, it was all very good!  We loved the way they served their cocktails- with big balls of ice the flavor of the mixer.  To note because they were excellent- black snapper sashimi, black cod with butter lettuce, Hawaiian edamame, and chocolate souffle.

XLd5y-YTdlzBWwxi3pOcSQ.text: Very very good boarding lining on brilliant. Coming from the Venetian via Uber, my wife says to me fifteen minutes in, "Where are you taking me so far away from the strip?". "You'll see" Is all I said. Yes, it's a ways from ground zero prime strip but I knew that going in. Dinner at Nobu would have set us back nearly $500.00. With the Uber fare and all in at Sen of Japan we got by for about $250.00 for two people. Half! We did the 6 Course Omakase for $60.00 per person. I added Seared Albacore with Enoki Mushroom Garlic Ponzu, and Garlic Shrimp. It was just the right amount of food for us. We each got our own plate of each dish. Course 1 Garlic Yellowtail with Yuzu Soy. Fresh, delicious! Course 2 Sashimi Salad w/Capers, Garlic Olive Oil (Tuna, Salmon, and Albacore). Perfect. Bring it on. They slipped in my order of Seared Albacore with Enoki Mushroom Garlic Ponzu. Yum! F Yeah! Barvo! Course 3 Black Cod Soy Get in my belly. Absolutely addictive. I'd like 5 more of these tasty morsels please. Course 4 Filet Mignon Steak Course. Devine! Cooked to a perfect medium rare. Endorphin rush coming on.... Course 5 Sushi Course. They added my order of Garlic Shrimp to this course for us. Garlic Shrimp Nigiri was good. Loved it. Went for first piece of sushi, record scratch sound effect: youtube.com/watch?v=rJYR... Hey, this sushi is cold, premade and refrigerated? No you didn't! Fish too cold, rice cold, not warm. Sushi foul has been committed. Jiro would not have been pleased. I was so happy with everything we had before I'm letting it go. Everything was fresh. I mentioned it to the waiter and he said the fridge was off by a few degrees. Not sure why anything was put into a fridge to begin with. Miso Soup with Clam was great. I guess this in not considered one of the courses. Course 6 Molten chocolate cake and Green Tea Ice Cream. Lovely. This was the best dinner we had on our 3 night trip. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great off strip Japanese restaurant. The place was great for a nice quiet dinner on a weeknight.

photos.caption: Photo of Sen of Japan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 6 Course Omakase Menu.  Molten chocolate cake and Green Tea Ice Cream. Sweet!
Photo of Sen of Japan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 6 Course Omakase Menu.  Miso Soup with Clam.  Good!
Photo of Sen of Japan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 6 Course Omakase Menu.  Miso Soup with Clam.  Good!

YGkG6PWu3FwOUXgHF7McoQ.text: Two Words: Hidden Gem   This is a local favorite. Honestly, the few places to get fresh sushi in Vegas.  My favorite is the lobster roll - it is worth the $. If sushi is not your thing, they have lots of other options meat, vegetarian and seafood. My go-to would be the black cod - so flavorful.   As for drinks, they offer a variety of sake. I got this really interesting cocktail that comes with a sphere ice cube.   Service is always impeccable and they are so warm!

OwYzIHRriYvtRwa7Bz6V3w.text: AMAZING SUSHI great quality & fresh. I usually only eat at sushi fever but this place is great. Wish they were open for lunch too.

VaemHGwlG-i7nVTwTqhv3w.text: This place is off the strip and worth the 20 minute drive. Reservarions for a business dinner of 6 at 7:30pm. They were ready and sat us a bit early, 7:15pm. Rick was our waiter for the night. The restaurant is so clean and not crowded with tables and chairs. Restroom is very clean, male and female separated.  Our waiter, RICK, recommended the Rick's Omakase (server choose everything for us). Rick choose every single thing we ate and drank. He served us the Wakatake green saki, So refreshing!!! Then he brought us the Soto saki, also cold, a little better on the taste buds.  Rick listened to what we commented on all food and adjusted our menu as needed. We ordered a roll with serrano chiles and the chef placed one piece alone on a plate for my friend. This was done many times to accommodate her weakness for spicy foods. This is the first place I have ever been to and been made to feel like family. The Chef prepared every dish with exactly 6 pieces so everyone one of us tasted a piece. My most fav sushi, besides ALL of them, was the garlic shrimp!! Absolutely loved it here!! Will return and you should make this a must stop if you are ever in the area!!!
